programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Slade takes us around the hometown hunting grounds and shows us some of the last bits of preparation for the season. An old buck that’s been showing up on camera at night decides to daylight and pays the price.

This week we celebrate the 40th Anniversary of Lone Wolf stands and the man that started it all, the Lone Wolf himself Andrae D’Acquisto. As we take a look back at Andrae’s career, how it all started and where its heading after 4 decades, Andrae shares some insights on his hunting strategies and the equipment he has designed that made him one of the top bowhunters in the country!
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Join Will Cooper on an unforgettable adventure in the Colorado mountains, where he dedicated three years chasing elusive bull elk without success. Determined to turn the tide, Will enlists the expertise of his good friend Jermaine Hodge, prior World Elk Calling Champion and Wrestling Coach for the United States Army World Class Athlete Program. Together, they face challenges and overcome adversity during a thrilling public land over-the-counter rifle hunt. Experience the highs and lows of their journey against the stunning backdrop of Colorado's wilderness.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: In the wide world of western big game, pronghorn antelope hunting in Wyoming is unmatched in its accessibility and excitement. It’s an active pursuit, typically ripe with plenty of opportunities to spot and stalk black-horned bucks. This makes it an ideal forum for riflemen looking to scratch their western itch.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After several years of shifting focus back to his native whitetails, Dahlke returns to mule deer country with the Muley Freak, Erik Van Woerkom. Follow along on this Utah mule deer hunt.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: From the ground up host Randy Birdsong will take you through the trials and tribulations of owning his first farm and grooming it to be one of the best whitetail hunting properties in the country

programme.title: Behind The Draw
programme.sub-title: "6 Year Old Tags FIRST EVER Buck!!"
programme.desc: Nothing can replace the early memories for a bowhunter. Join the journey as Jack Wirsig draws a youth tag and attempts to harvest his first ever deer at 6 Years Old!!

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Can You Surf & Eat Like a Local in Minnesota? Wild Foraging & Delicious Local Eats"
programme.desc: In Episode 3, Josh starts off in the Twin Cities where he meets up with Yia Vang, an award-winning Hmong chef and restaurant owner, bringing his family’s traditions and flavors to the American Midwest. As Josh heads up north to Duluth and the boundary waters, he’ll meet plenty of farmers and foragers—harvesting mushrooms, wild rice, and catching a few fish (and waves) along the way. It all wraps up with an epic feast hosted by Yia back in the cities.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Exploring New York City's Hidden Culinary Gems: Cooking Goat Brains, Lobster & MORE"
programme.desc: New. York. City. That’s where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4—and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredients—from sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintan’s kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.sub-title: DIRT - "Exploring Japanese Street Food and Local Surfing Spots | DIRT Japan: Kyushu"
programme.desc: "Hope you're hungry. In this episode, come along as we eat our weight in sushi and ramen, meet nori farmers and wagyu ranchers, and make some new surfing buddies along the way. P.S. if you're hungry for more Japan content, stay tuned for our next two episodes. - In this episode of DIRT, the crew road tripped around Kyushu. The food culture in Kyushu dates back to the emperors of Japan, and the Black Current off the eastern shore has shaped the island's cuisine for centuries. The DIRT team followed that current up the coastline, surfing with new friends and tasting new flavors. And with each stop, we learned even more about how the traditions we keep can honor thousands of years of knowledge—and point the way to the future."

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Mark Kayser enters the South Dakota frozen tundra after a handful of mature rutting whitetails.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt heads to Nebraska to talk to the experts at Hornady ammunition and get their take and what the best calibers are for whitetail deer hunting.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Editor-n-Chief Dan Schmidt unravels the social structure of the whitetail doe community. Meanwhile, already tagged out on a big buck in Texas, outdoor writer Brad Fenson turns his sights onto mature does.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor head offshore to the Marathon Hump, taking advantage of the 26-feet hybrid boat's versatility to find some exciting Blackfin and Skipjack Tuna fishing.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by scientist Nick Haddad, who educates our hosts and the fishing world on the various descending devices used to preserve stressed catch from deeper waters as the three of them get into some fun Red Snapper fishing off the coast of Marathon, Florida in the Keys.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor are joined by Rich's son Reed, who takes the wheel and directs the team into some amazing early morning baby tarpon fishing in the Everglades.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor take Hunter Smallback into the Everglades for some snook fishing, and the action really heats up when some hungry Lemon sharks crash the party.

programme.title: TRP
programme.sub-title: "Cleaning up our Oceans with Capt. Neill Holland"
programme.desc: his week, I welcome back Capt. Neill Holland of Ocean Aid 360! Ocean Aid 360 along with Reef Relief, Surfrider, CCA, Beach Weekend, FWC, and NOAA, are leading a THREE DAY marine debris cleanup event that spans four hours each day, featuring daily raffle prizes, free lunches, and swag bags. They are inviting walkers, boaters, kayakers, and paddlers to join forces for a much-needed cleanup of the area. You can participate for one day or all three! Not only will you have a chance to WIN major prizes through daily raffles, but you'll also be contributing to the preservation of marine habitats and wildlife. - The event starts 9/13/23 and ends 9/15/23. You can learn more and join this clean up here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/key-haven-coastal-community-cleanup-tickets-709576130307?aff=ebdsoporgprofile - At Ocean Aid 360, the belief is clear: environmental preservation and the livelihoods of marine-dependent communities are inseparable. Captain Neill Holland, a St. Pete, Florida native with a rich background in marine conservation, shares his journey from a career at National Geographic magazine to leading this impactful non-profit. - Tune in to gain insights into the remarkable work of Ocean Aid 360 and Captain Neill Holland's dedication to the preservation of our marine ecosystems. It's an episode filled with hope, innovation, and a shared vision of a brighter future for our oceans. - Follow Capt Neill on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/gofishtampabay/ - Follow OCEAN AID 360 on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/oceanaid360 - https://www.oceanaid360.org - https://www.gofishtampabay.com - #MarineConservation #OceanAid360 #MarineDebrisCleanup #CommunityCleanup #CleanOceans #EnvironmentalStewardship #MarineHabitat #VolunteerForChange #SaveOurSeas #EcoFriendly #WildlifeProtection #SustainableLiving #ProtectTheOcean #RafflePrizes #BeachCleanup #ConservationHeroes #EnvironmentalPartnerships #OceanProtection #CoastalCleanup #CleanerOceans #TeamSeas - WEBSITES: - http://www.saltwaterexperience.com - http://www.tomrowlandpodcast.com - STREAM ALL OUR FULL SEASONS ON WAYPOINT TV: http://waypointtv.com/#!/saltwaterexperience

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike heads to Venice, LA, to explore a unique bayou technique —beach fishing for redfish and black drum in the heart of the Gulf.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: Highlighting guests Dalton Smith; Dalton coached Campbellsville University Kayak Bass Team. Fished high school in KY; Mark watched him as a youth angle. Dalton caught two 14lb+ bass on the same day once. The 23-year-old uprooted from his area to follow this dream full time in OH.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: David Blanton hunts with long-time friend, Richard Reid, in Mississippi. Then, he takes on the tough task of self-filming a turkey hunt. Will he succeed and fill a turkey tag on camera? Let's find out.

programme.title: Goin' Coastal
programme.desc: Josh heads offshore for the first day of red snapper season with his friend Joe Koenraad.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: 14 year old Fly Angler Stevie Kim-Rubell joins Jared in Islamorada.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob and long time friend and tournament angler Mitch Widom have a fly rod in hand and go in search of tarpon in Islamorada.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: CA heads to the scenic Low country of South Carolina for part one of an epic two-part redfish adventure.

programme.title: Flats Class
programme.desc: The South Carolina redfish mission continues! C.A. and Stephen hunt for redfish in unfamiliar territory.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake joins some old friends on board the Fall Line in hopes of scoring big in the Bay Point Billfish Open. This trip will test the limits of all the anglers as the skilled captain and crew do the impossible in hopes of bringing home the prize.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: From the ground up host Randy Birdsong will take you through the trials and tribulations of owning his first farm and grooming it to be one of the best whitetail hunting properties in the country

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: With everything breaking down Dustin and Randy head to an auction to hopefully save their weekend plans of getting seed into the ground.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer season’s past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.sub-title: "Islamorada Blackfins And Mahis With Capt Scott Stoky"
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve start the season with Capt. Scott Stoky chasing Islamorada Tunas and Mahis offshore out of Plantation Boat Mart.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve catch a mixed bag bottom fishing off of Islamorada with Captain Scott Stoky.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve go yellow tailing out of Hawks Cay for a limit of tasty yellowtail snapper and Steve picks a battle with a big lemon shark.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott and Steve bounce around the reefs out of Hawks Cay catching a wide variety of reef dwellers.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Snapper and Grouper out in the Gulf of Mexico are waiting for Brandon Simmons and Eric Davis. They just have to ride the sporty chop to get to them.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Snapper and Grouper out in the Gulf of Mexico are waiting for Brandon Simmons and Eric Davis. They just have to ride the sporty chop to get to them.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is at - John’s lake house on Tupper Lake, NY, where they are tackling a new paint Job using Interlux’s paint specifically designed for aluminum hulls. John and the crew take us step by step on what takes to paint on aluminum hulls as well as some other tips from guest hosts.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is taking - the Marine Surplus Console for the Aqua sport project and giving it a much needed face lift. They meet the team at Boat Outfitters to find an acrylic covering board to fit the console and cover the pre existing holes. They then head over to meet with crew at AwlGrip to get some ideas on color matching the console with the Aqua sport.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, we are cruising the islands of the Caribbean on board a luxury super yacht. From Antigua to Martinique, St Lucia to the Grenadines, it’s a picture perfect paradise.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, our luxury cruise through the Caribbean continues, calling into ports including Guadeloupe, St Kitts & Nevis and the ultracool St Barts.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, David Genat is cruising the Caribbean through the US and British Virgin Islands before finishing up in colorful and vibrant Puerto Rico.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway our favorite foodie Poh Ling Yeow is enjoying a wonderful wintery cruise through Europe’s Christmas Markets, taste-testing all the delicious festive treats.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon explores the sunken vessels and beautiful waters of the Florida Panhandle with local guide, Brady Hale.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Brandon learns how to return fish caught out of deep water using a descending device, a tool that is helping conserve the fish population everywhere that it is being used.

programme.title: Life On The Water
